Hillary Clinton: s voting record on trade agreements: The expert mentions that Bernie Sanders claimed that Clinton "voted for virtually every trade agreement." The expert verifies this claim by stating that Clinton supported six out of the ten trade deals she had the opportunity to vote on as a senator from New York.
Clinton: s acceptance of campaign contributions from special interests: Sanders accused Clinton of having a super PAC that raised money from every special interest, including $15 million from Wall Street. The expert mentions this aspect of the claim but does not provide further information or verification.
Impact of trade agreements on job loss: Sanders claimed that trade agreements supported by Clinton have cost the country "millions of jobs." The expert mentions that this claim is up for debate and that Sanders is exaggerating slightly, but does not provide a definitive verdict on the authenticity of this aspect of the claim.
